title: Help me pick the right on.. (letter paper)
content:
Please help me pick the right one.

Letter paper for a carpentry company.

I got these 6 different letter papers form a graphic designer.  
I think it should be No. 3 or 4.

What do you think???

Martin Vam Sølund

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Brevpapir.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120071444/http:/typophile.com/files/Brevpapir.pdf) | 358.26 KB |

 [‹ Rawkes Design - Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120071444/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33797 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120071444/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33774 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Danish

comments.content: I would go with 4, never 3 and maybe 1 or 2. Centering the name at the top is very 19th Century - so if you do restoration carpentry then it might be ok but in that case choose a 19th Century font. Try typing a letter on 4, I think it creates a nice feel.

I’m liking 4 too. But screen that watermark WAY back. What looks fine on a blank sheet soon overpowers a a page with actual type on it.

I’d also suggest moving the black bar over another 1/2” or so so it could line up with the left margin of the actual text on the page.

why don’t you trust your current designer? they understand your objectives and market in more detail than we do ... hopefully.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120071444/http:/www.solid-creative.com/design.htm)

Hi

Thanks for the respond. I will use No. 4

Paul, I do trust my designer, but still think 10 eyes sees better than 2.....

cheers martin
